org.apache.gearpump.streaming.state.impl

Class WindowState<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.gearpump.streaming.state.api.MonoidState<T>
      • org.apache.gearpump.streaming.state.impl.WindowState<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PersistentState<T>

    public class WindowState<T>
extends MonoidState<T>
    this is a list of states, each of which is bounded by a time window state of each window doesn't affect each other

    WindowState requires a Algebird Group to be passed in Group augments Monoid with a minus function which makes it possible to undo the update by messages that have left the window

      • getInterval

        public Interval getInterval(long timestamp,
                            long checkpointTime)
        Each message will update state in corresponding Interval[StartTime, endTime),

        which is decided by the message's timestamp t where 

        
 startTime = Math.max(lowerBound1, lowerBound2, checkpointTime)
 endTime = Math.min(upperBound1, upperBound2, checkpointTime)
 lowerBound1 = step * Nmax1 <= t
 lowerBound2 = step * Nmax2 + size <= t
 upperBound1 = step * Nmin1 > t
 upperBound2 = step * Nmin2 + size > t
        Parameters:
        timestamp - (undocumented)
        checkpointTime - (undocumented)
        Returns:
        (undocumented)

      • updateIntervalStates
